title: Walmart Neighborhood Market Brings New Jobs and Fresh Groceries to Fayetteville
text:
New Walmart Neighborhood Market located at 8660 Cliffdale Road Fayetteville Walmart creates about 95 new jobs Store open 24 hours a day, seven days a week Grand opening event Wednesday, Sept. 9, 7:30 a.m. Local Facebook page: www.facebook.com/walmart3411 
FAYETTEVILLE, N.C., Sept. 2, 2015 - The new Walmart Neighborhood Market in Fayetteville will open to the community Wednesday, Sept. 9, bringing a broad assortment of fresh, affordable groceries at Walmart's everyday low prices. Customers will also enjoy the convenience of on-site services such as a full pharmacy and fuel station, and a free store pickup service providing an easy way to shop millions of products on Walmart.com. The new store will employ up to 95 full- and part-time associates. 
"We are proud to be a part of the Fayetteville community," said store manager Bruce Main. "We look forward to opening and providing area residents with Walmart's everyday low prices, especially as we are stocked with fresh items for back-to-school lunches and all the game time favorites heading into football season." 
Fresh, Affordable Produce, Meat and Groceries The store offers fresh produce and meat, pantry staples and a full line of groceries from leading brands. 
In addition to organics and nutritious food choices, customers will also find a full-service deli and in-store bakery, and in-store baked pizzas. 
Full Service Pharmacy The Neighborhood Market includes a pharmacy with a full range of products, immunizations and services and Walmart pharmacists ready to assist customers with product and prescription questions. Fayetteville residents can easily transfer prescriptions and order refills on the go with the Walmart mobile app. A drive thru pharmacy window makes prescription drop off and pick up quick and easy. 
Millions of Items with Seamless Digital and In-Store Shopping The store is approximately 41,000 square feet and offers a wide assortment of products to meet the needs of Fayetteville residents. Customers will find health and beauty aids, pet products and cleaning supplies. Shopping is more convenient than ever as Fayetteville residents can shop seven million items on Walmart.com, many of which can be shipped for free to any Walmart store through Walmart Pickup. 
The Walmart mobile app for iPhone and Android makes shopping easier than ever. Customers can refill prescription medications, create shopping lists, search the location of items in their store, check weekly ads and prices, save eReceipts and shop Walmart.com through the app. 
"I am excited that Walmart has chosen to build more new stores in our area," said Fayetteville Mayor Nat Robertson. "The three new Neighborhood Markets we will see opened here this year will employ almost 300 people, almost all of whom will be local citizens. Stores like this continue to provide excellent job opportunities for the city of Fayetteville." 
"In addition, Walmart gives back to the community through community involvement," Robertson added. "The Cliffdale store, for example, will be involved with the Wounded Warrior Project, helping our local Wounded Warriors, who are part of the fabric of our citizen landscape. 
Job Opportunities at Walmart The store will employ up to 95 associates for full- and part-time positions within the store. Applicants interested in careers at Walmart can apply at a store's hiring kiosk or online at Walmartcareers.com . Main began his Walmart career in 1996 as an hourly sporting goods associate at a store in Wallace, N.C. 
At Walmart, more than 75 percent of store management teams started as hourly associates. In 2014, 160,000 associates are promoted, and 40 percent of those promotions go to associates within the first year of their employment. Earlier this year Walmart announced it would be making more than a $1B investment in higher wages and training and other enhancements for its associates. 
Community Giving The grand-opening celebration includes presentations of grants from the Walmart Foundation to local community groups. The new store will also continue a commitment by Walmart and the Walmart Foundation to fight hunger in Fayetteville and across the U.S. Walmart and the Walmart Foundation recently exceeded a $2 billion goal to fight hunger one year ahead of schedule and have donated more than 1.5 billion pounds of food to those in need across the country. 
Two Celebration Events: Grand Opening and A Big Family Welcome Local associates will provide a special welcome to members of Fayetteville at two public events. Store associates will host a brief ribbon-cutting ceremony on grand opening day, Sept. 9, at 7:30 a.m. The following Saturday, Sept. 12, local residents are invited to A Big Family Welcome, which will give customers a chance to meet Main and enjoy fun family activities and free food samples while supplies last. Join the celebration from noon to 3 p.m. 
About Walmart Wal-Mart Stores, Inc. (NYSE: WMT) helps people around the world save money and live better - anytime and anywhere - in retail stores, online, and through their mobile devices. Each week, we serve nearly 260 million customers who visit our 11,532 stores under 65 banners in 28 countries and e-commerce websites in 11 countries. With fiscal year 2015 revenue of $486 billion, Walmart employs more than 2 million associates worldwide. Walmart continues to be a leader in sustainability, corporate philanthropy and employment opportunity. Additional information about Walmart can be found by visiting http://corporate.walmart.com on Facebook at http://facebook.com/walmart and on Twitter at http://twitter.com/walmart .
